title: Trace: Type Mismatch in Operation
story: Someone tried to add a string to a number, causing a TypeError. Understanding type errors helps you catch data type mismatches early.
instructions: Examine the stack trace and code snippet. Answer the questions to show your diagnostic skills.

hints.text: TypeError happens when you use an operation with incompatible types.
The error message tells you exactly what operation failed and which types were involved.

traceReading.stackTrace:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "main.py", line 3, in <module>
    total = age + years
TypeError: unsupported operand type(s) for +: 'int' and 'str'
traceReading.buggyCode:
age = 25
years = '10'
total = age + years
print(total)

questions.question: Which two data types caused the conflict?
How would you fix this error?
questions.correctAnswer: Convert years to int: int(years) or convert age to str: str(age)
